timeline.bodyText: Dumb question, but isn't easier to just use Enum.ordinal() and reorder the items?
timeline.author: gastaldi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -15,22 +15,28 @@
 public final class CodestartSpec {
 
     enum Type {
-        PROJECT(true),
-        LANGUAGE(true),
-        BUILDTOOL(true),
-        CONFIG(true),
-        CODE(false),
-        TOOLING(false);
+        PROJECT(true, 3),
+        LANGUAGE(true, 1),
+        BUILDTOOL(true, 2),
+        CONFIG(true, 4),
+        CODE(false, 6),
+        TOOLING(false, 5);

replies.bodyText: @gastaldi, I guess that would aso do, but this makes it clear that we actually use the order if someone adds/change a value IMO
replies.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText:
IMHO it is more likely someone could introduce the same order number than change the enum order (which is more visible) 🤣
But it's your call 😉
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText: @gastaldi introducing the same would be alright, it means they are the same level and would be compared by name
replies.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText: @gastaldi I think if no one else objects I will stick to that implementation. beside that, is the PR ok? could you approve the PR?
replies.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText:
I agree having an explicit order is better. I could see how someone could reorder them alphabetically without noticing.
Now the question is: why are they in a random order? Can't we properly order them too?
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: My question is not only about it being nicer, having things in a random order makes adding new items more error prone.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
@gsmet the given order is not random:

language is first as it defines the language for the others
buildtool is second as it is also important for the others
project then can give overrides on those
config and tooling could be at the same level
code needs to be last

For now I think it doesn't really matter as soon as the order is consistent between run, but I am creating an issue for this as the order for data overriding may need to be different from the order of processing. I don't think we want the examples codestarts to override base data.
replies.author: ia3andy

replies.bodyText:
What I'm saying is that the order of the enum values is random.
The enum values should be sorted by execution order so that it's less error prone.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: I created an issue for the data overriding order as it may also be important: #11754
replies.author: ia3andy

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    PROJECT(true, 3),
          
          
            
                    LANGUAGE(true, 1),
          
          
            
                    BUILDTOOL(true, 2),
          
          
            
                    CONFIG(true, 4),
          
          
            
                    CODE(false, 6),
          
          
            
                    TOOLING(false, 5);
          
          
            
                    LANGUAGE(true, 1),
          
          
            
                    BUILDTOOL(true, 2),
          
          
            
                    PROJECT(true, 3),
          
          
            
                    CONFIG(true, 4),
          
          
            
                    TOOLING(false, 5),
          
          
            
                    CODE(false, 6);
